title: Quantmod and TTR
text: cryptoQuotes package provides access major cryptocurrency exchanges around world uses xts zoo seamlessly works powerful packages like quantmod ttr.

title: Quantmod and TTR
text: demonstrate interoperability cryptoQuotes quantmod, extract data Binance futures market USDT denominated ATOM Note: default, getQuote returns UTC index may trigger warning depending timezone. getQuote returns Open, High, Low, Close Volumes can visualized using chartSeries quantmod without programming. can pass ATOMUSDT directly chartSeries adding bollinger bands indicators using quantmod::addBBands
code: ## load USDT denominated ATOM ## with hourly intervals ## for September ATOMUSDT <- cryptoQuotes::getQuote(   ticker = 'ATOMUSDT',   source = 'binance',   futures = TRUE,   interval = '1d',   from = '2023-01-01',   to   = '2023-01-11' ) ## head data head(   ATOMUSDT ) #>              Open   High    Low  Close   Volume #> 2023-01-01  9.351  9.473  9.296  9.455  3963331 #> 2023-01-02  9.454 10.094  9.374  9.813 11158277 #> 2023-01-03  9.812 10.350  9.751 10.146 11171001 #> 2023-01-04 10.146 10.450 10.028 10.189  8433311 #> 2023-01-05 10.188 10.228  9.981 10.081  5426319 #> 2023-01-06 10.077 10.287  9.902 10.243  7090340 ## chart the spotAtom ## with candlesticks quantmod::chartSeries(   x     = ATOMUSDT,   theme = quantmod::chartTheme('white') ) #> Registered S3 method overwritten by 'quantmod': #>   method            from #>   as.zoo.data.frame zoo ## add Bollinger ## bands quantmod::addBBands(n = 2)
